content: as soon as truth is confined (determined to be finished) a border crossing does not seem impossible; there’s something else than truth, something better, truth is finite, c’est fini
disquieting phrases need to be sheltered behind paternity [re: “limits of truth” in quotes]

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: whenever someone speaks of someone else, cites or praises him or her, one must hear: this is the story of my life [re: Diderot accusing Seneca, pardoning Seneca, asking for pardon himself]
[re: Diderot, Seneca, De la brièveté de la vie] borders w/ respect to death, borders of truth, borders of property
proper of our existence belongs as much to us as we belong to it [double possession]
via Seneca & Diderot, one would guard jealously one’s time above all else; to “master” “my life” > know difference btwn giving one’s time & wasting one’s time
Diderot: mediocrity attributed as much to lack of time as lack of talent
time, we have a right to be miserly about
jealousy: primitive passion for the proper, for proper possibility re: one’s existence
via Seneca, death (immanence of a disappearance) seals union of possible and impossible
Cicero was one of the first conscientious translators
insofar as a sentence speaks, it testifies to its belonging to a language, an inclusion different from any other mode of inclusion (social class, soil, blood, citizenship, geo-graphic, etc.)
death w/out limit as limit to cross (pas)
once totalities are overdetermined, contaminated, by events of language (of mark), which they also imply, they are no longer identical to themselves
pas [belongs to French?] involves the line that terminates all determination, peras (end, limit) not telos, puts us on path beyond, on other side, peraō eis khoran (penetrate into place, country)
totalities are overdetermined, rather, contaminated by events of language
il y va d’un certain pas
“coming to pass” of event doesn’t have the movement of passing, traversing, or transiting, a coming without pas, impossible passage, prohibited passage, indeed nonpassage
one should avoid wasting time speaking in shibboleths, passwords, unless it gains you time
shibboleth effect, untranslatability (essential incompleteness of translation), borders of untranslatability w/in original language itself
true hospitality is to receive hospitality from your guest (infinity lost in abyss of endekhomenon, the entire meditation of khora in Timaeus)
border becomes a problem as soon as edge-line is threatened, a step crossing an indivisible line (customs, police, visa—all established upon institution of indivisibility or identity of line)
aporia, experience of what’s fascinating in the nonpassage: “not knowing where to go,” paralyzed by separation
guest must be free to come or not come
every border is problematic in sense of problēma (projection, dissimulation, shield, prosthesis put forth to represent, replace, shelter, hide something unavowable)
[khora receives, permits all crossings?]

a line (police) line must be indivisible = identity, when line is divided, as it is by its 1<sup><small>st</small></sup> tracings, it splits in two > there is a problem (shield) as soon as the being one-self of anything is divided (intrinsic division)

before  a door, threshold, border, approach of the other as such [think Kafka, Blanchot], there is “no longer any problem,” without protection, without prosthesis [?], w/out possible substitution, singularly exposed, naked, delivered over to the other, can’t protect the interiority of the secret; can’t find a border still to cross [anxiety before fantasy?]
Derrida puts problēma in tension with aporia
Heidegger thinks beyond “vulgar concept of time that privileges now,” Derrida asks: “is there anything other than vulgar time & vulgar death” [see OS]
Derrida retraces his steps through Heidegger in OS: Kant, Hegel inherited exoteric aporia from Aristotle, dialectic repeats exoteric aporia as “brilliant formulation of vulgar paradox”
[Derrida quickly reviews many places in his own work where he studied aporetology, paradoxical limitrophy, double bind]

Derrida reminds us of his method [in OS] (orient confirmation [of Heidegger] toward another suggestion, even will supporting it): can the experience of the time be anything other than vulgar? what if exoteric aporia was irreducible, called for experience of oppositions from both sides of indivisible line [?] > a nonvulgar concept, to the so-called vulgar concept
border as limit (oros, Grenze, re: nun or Jetzt [now-point] Heidegger underlines) or border as tracing (grammē, Linie)
deconstruction: aporetic experience of the impossible
undecidable quasi-concepts, so many aporetic places or dislocations: double bind, double band
experience means traversal without line, without indivisible line, passage, rite of passage, can it ever concern surpassing an aporia? can there be an experience of the aporia as such?
most general/indeterminate form of double single duty: responsible decision must obey an “it is necessary” that owes nothing, owes nothing in order to be a duty, duty w/out debt, thus w/out duty
nonpassive endurance of aporia: condition of responsibility, neither dialectizable contradiction like Hegel, Marx, nor transcendental illusion like Kant
aporia rather than antinomy, or antinomy as an interminable experience

two types of border: 1) border that passes among contents (things, objects, referents: countries, states, nations, cultures, etc.) 2) border that passes btwn a concept (singularly that of duty) and its other, acc. bar of oppositional logic

decision concerns choice btwn relation w/ a wholly non-opposable other (an other that’s not its other) and an other who is its other (can be opposed in a couple) > the former relation is that of aporia, not a crossing of border but a double concept of the border
but, should not abandon programs, they are the guardrail of a responsibility to whose calling they remain radically heterogenous
affirmation that announces itself in negative form is experience itself, experience of aporia (passage and nonpassage coupled in aporia itself)
experience of aporia: passion, endurance, resistance, remainder
to protect decision or responsibility by knowledge, theoretical assurance, is to transform this experience into deployment of program

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: choice of negative form (aporia) to designate a duty announces affirmation by avoiding good conscience at all costs
the 2 forms of good conscience [1) grimace of indulgent vulgarity 2) subjective certainty] incompatible w/ absolute risk of every promise, engagement, responsibility
the 2 versions of aporia’s nonpassage: 1) impermeable, only opens via shibboleth, closed borders (i.e. during war) 2) impasse of no limit, limit too porous, no opposition btwn 2 sides
paradox of aporia: multiple figures of aporia do not oppose figures to each other, “instead installs the haunting of the one in the other”
as soon as conditions are converted to positive certainty we are being deceived, indeed we are deceiving the other
good conscience has inexhaustible resources: even unsmiling of declared bad conscience—supplementary ruse
we can never say these are the conditions of inexhaustible singularity of event, must speak in negative form (w/out X no Y) [Derrida against present or presentation of “this is that”]

if death names irreplaceability of absolute singularity (no one can die in my place or in place of the other) then all examples in world can illustrate this singularity, death of all those who say “my death” is irreplaceable [universal?] > tout autre est tout autre
that anybody can appropriate expression “my death” > exemplary complication of exemplarity: nothing more nor less substitutable than syntagm “my death,” hapax legomenon
quotation marks: name words or names
one does not know meaning or referent of word “death,” can’t predicate it, like “God”
“my death,” a flashing light at every border, it’s awake, can always see a nightwatchman (du veilleur) or a nightlight (de la veilleuse)
aporia: not even the non-pas but the deprivation of pas (a-pas)
three limits: 1) territories, countries, languages, States… 2) discourses: theology, sciences… 3) types of border (conceptual de-terminations)
mobile slash btwn and/or, and/and, or/and, or/or: a singular border, simultaneously disjunctive, conjunctive, undecidable

in crossing a border, one changes/exchanges death (on change le mort, on change de mort), one passes from figure of death as trespass (passage of line, transgression of border, pas au-delà) to another figure of border btwn life and death
every culture characterized by way of its dealing w/, its “living” death as trespass
historians of death never ask the question “what is death?”
for Heidegger, death cannot be enclosed w/in sexual borders (which crisscross cultural, linguistic, national, religious borders)

Heidegger distinguishes death of Dasein from its end (Ende), from its maturation or ripeness (Reife), Dasein don’t need to mature when death occurs, not a final maturity, not an limit end, a telos, terma, a border > Dasein is very transgression of this borderline
Derrida policing misuse of Heidegger
for Heidegger, precipitous concepts of death not only a speculative failure, they introduce empirical or techno-juridical confusions becoming more serious today

death one of the names of a threat, an aporia, that risks paralyzing ontological, hierarchical, territorial apparatus to which Heidegger lends credit; death, in this sense, names what Heidegger early on called “ruination” [look up]
ontology of Dasein superordinate (vorgeordneten) to ontology of life [hierarchy in Heidegger]
Heidegger’s hierarchy, desire to think death properly, division btwn ontic & ontological, imposes pure, rigorous, indivisible borders, borders that are crossed but shouldn't be

re: Heidegger’s Verenden, the coming to an end that all living things share, Derrida prefers translation “perishing,” “périr” to “arrêt de vie” because retains per of passage to limit, pereo, perire, crosses line, though losing sense of corrupting, ending in ver of verenden

abyssal inquiry re: Heidegger’s delimitation of death, modes of ending, more than one limit, ends of man an indestructable (increvable) subject > death of Dasein not end of man, btwn the 2 there’s a divisible limit, perhaps, of ending, place where ending ends [?]
“deconstruction” of Heidegger’s border between dying & perishing, if it does not discredit it, gives it another status
when someone suggests a solution to an impasse, that person ceases to understand, if he ever did
great works, like Being and Time, neither science, philosophy nor poetics
border most difficult to delineate: that the arrivant makes possible everything it cannot be reduced to
border of absolute arrivant keeps one from discriminating btwn figures of arrivant > the dead, the revenant (the ghost, he or she that returns)
absolute arrivant, no more commands than commanded by memory of originary event where archaic is bound to final extremity (telos, eskhaton)
annihilates prior identity (p. 34)
as disarmed as a newly born child (p. 34) [Nietzsche]
arrives w/out expecting it (s’y attendre)
absolute arrivant: singularity of “who” arrives or neutrality of that which arrives
affects (brings to light) experience of threshold before one knows if there’s been a call, nomination or promise (Verheissung, Heissen, etc.)
not an invader, invasion presupposes some self-identity, arrivant does not cross a threshold separating two identifiable borders
[compare Derrida’s arrivant to Nietzsche’s master]
Heidegger & Kant: man only example of not-man man (Dasein, finite reasonable being)
Heidegger: only man can experience death as such
Heidegger says animal cannot experience death as such, and that animal cannot speak [Derrida draws out undeveloped relation btwn language and death]

if death can’t be experienced as such both to language and to what exceeds language, border btwn animal & Dasein would become unassignable p. 37 Ableben (demise) vs. Sterben (dying) vs. Verenden (perishing)
does distinction btwn demise and dying avoid Levinas’ objection to Heidegger re: “mineness” of dying > in dying proper and properly speaking, no one can die for the other
Heidegger: “Daisen never perishes (verendet nie), Dasein, however, can demise (ableben) only as long as it is dying (solange, als es stirbt)”
Heidegger’s distinction btwn sterben and verenden not irreconcilable w/ Freud’s thought re: fact that our mortality via death drive isn’t testified by science, our beliefs or the unconscious
that Dasein knows no end in sense of verenden, that it can only only perish as animal but not as Dasein, implies Dasein is immortal in its originary being-to-death
an originary mourning unthought by Heidegger, Levinas, Freud

aporia of death, one of the place-names that forms following braid btwn 3 forms of limits, keeps it from coming undone [see pp. 78-80 border, closure, demarcation] 1) problematic closure (around thematic entity) 2) anthropological border (animals don’t have borders, laws) 3) conceptual demarcation, logical de-finition (decontaminate 2 concepts, oppose them rigorously)

via Heidegger, there is no culture [p. 59 nor politics] of death itself of properly dying, question arises of limit btwn universal (non-natural) structure and differential (non-natural but cultural) structure
“culture of death”—a tautology? each culture treats death differently, w/ different partitions, culture of death = history of death (cult of ancestors, rituals of mourning/sacrifice)

motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

content: no culture, no medicine [pharmakon] w/out horizon of death
difference of animal/human, biological life/culture is the relation to death as such, true border would be there
always culture of death (sometimes just to incinerate ashes)
cultural partition around treatment of death: purely human, intra-anthropological
Heidegger: all thoughts of demise presuppose an anthropological (historical) or biological (natural) concept of death, which existential analytic of Dasein seeks to correct
existential analytic precedes, and is presupposed by other discourses of death, and founds (fundiert) them
no escaping ontologico-juridico-transcendental tradition [method], except w/ death, aporia, unique exclusion from system, “life death” no longer falls under case of what it makes possible
request for foundation or for condition of possibility speaks language of methodic order: 1) an order as in a whole 2) an order as in a sequence 3) an order as in a command
Ariès calls the “metaphysical” everything the historian must leave aside

“lived experience” is a ridiculous translation of Erlebnis (the measure of phenomenology) > how does it relate to Bezeugung (testimony)? Dasein never has the Erleben of its own demise (Ableben) but can testify to it, acc. Heidegger
for Heidegger, methodological propositions, problematic closures apply to “metaphysics of death”
universality of existential analysis of death (primitives have access to Dasein)
[via Heidegger’s performative incision, decision, “here”] figure of border, line between here & beyond (l’en-deça et l’au-delà) re: death, survival, immortality, beyond
existential analytic is method independent of, anterior to, this side (Disseits) of metaphysics

Heidegger places analytic of Dasein re: death here, on this side, before all ontical speculation operating beyond (ultra, meta, trans), by way of an uncontested, irrecusable decision (a performative incision) on the undecidable question of “here”: a testimony w/out proof
[Derrida on Heidegger’s incisive decisions and methodology in existential analytic]

methodological urgency in being-toward-death: we can only start from here (l’en-deça), “ontico-ontological priority of Dasein,” “exemplary” point of departure of existential analytic of Dasein, power of question of we, we here, that can listen/wait for each other

the 3 reasons Heidegger’s authoritative decision on what must remain undecided seems so decisive: 1) superordinating of existential analytic 2) the originary, underivable character of death, of finitude, forces us to decide 3) prevalence of phenomenological tradition, pre-ferring, pre-férance [with an “a”], pre-archic originarity of proper, eigentlich

the 3 reasons Heidegger’s authoritative decision on what must remain undecided seems so decisive: 1) superordinating of existential analytic 2) the originary, underivable character of death, of finitude, forces us to decide 3) prevalence of phenomenological tradition, pre-ferring, pre-férance [with an “a”], pre-archic originarity of proper, eigentlich

for Heidegger, all interest, belief in immortality, man’s irreducible torsion of retrospective anticipation (survival structure) in every instant (introduces untimely moment and posthumous in most alive of present living thing), stems from man’s mortality—is secondary [to being-toward-death] > only a “being-to-death” can think, desire, project, live immortality as such
Heidegger’s on Kant’s side, on this side of finitude > didn’t Hegel want to show unilaterality of border, and that one is already on the other side of the here? [hymen]
56 Heidegger’ rigorous methodological decision to start on “this side,” w/ pre-archic originarity of the proper, eigentlich, who can testify against it?
that which would make decision object of thematic knowledge must remain undecidable for there to be a decision
in Being and Time, Heidegger leaves questions re: undecidable (i.e. death) unanswered in order to decide on the undecidable [decides on use of phenomenological method]

decision to decide from “here” not simply methodological decision: decides that a method is pre-ferable to no-method, this absolute decision turns into non-decision since, as unconditional decision re: place/taking-place of decision, it relies on prevalence of what can’t be decided (i.e. death), leaving questions undecided, that would make one hesitate btwn decision/non-decision
only way for existential analytic of Dasein to achieve universality, must be only discipline where death knows no borders
when being-toward-death is universal, [death] crosses historical, cultural borders—still privileges human above animal
if death figures a line of thought, it’s because it takes figure, has a privileged form, crosses the line [re: Heiddegger’s attempt to think death beyond all figure]
everyone feels like “death is no longer what it used to be”
Heidegger refuses to use word universal even though his existential analysis of death wants to be (universal too humanistic for Heidegger, too dependent on Aufklärung)
no politics of death properly speaking [p. 42 no culture either]
Heidegger’s existential analysis has no competence for dealing w/ political problems of burial, cult of the dead
from kidnapping to hostage war (different modes of technology)
biopolitics is also thanato-politics, which is euthanato-politics, il faut bien mourir (ars de bene moriendi)
pass from hostage to host/guest from host/guest to ghost in series: hostage, host, guest, ghost, holy ghost, Geist
Heidegger not interested in revenant or mourning—just death itself, not its figures or experiences of demise (Ableben)
for Derrida, in contrast to Heidegger [Freud & Levinas too?], mourning, revenance, spectrality, living-on, surviving: non-derivable categories or non-reducible derivations
untranslatability of idiom can produce effects of shibboleth

all politics require time & space of mourning, a topolitology of sepulcher, anamnesic (thematic) relation to spirit as revenant, open hospitality to guest as ghost [in English] whom one holds, as he holds us, hostage
Heidegger suggests diagnosis of problematic closures, they forget essence of Dasein, lock Dasein into ontological determination that is not its own, that of Vorhandensein
analysis of death, always close to the heart for Heidegger

“if being-possible is the being proper to Dasein, then the existential analysis of the death of Dasein will have to make of this possibility its theme” > death is possibility par excellence, exemplarily guides existential analysis
two ontological statements [re: Heidegger] of possibility articulate, engender, supplement each other: 2 moments of a single aporetic sentence
irreducible prescriptivity in mode of phenomenological attestation (Bezeugung) > one can and must testify to it

triple transitivity of s’attendre: 1) oneself 2) arrivant, the other 3) await each other, which is immediately consonant w/ reference to tout autre [cf. HST p. 360] ——for Heidegger, only w/ death does one await oneself, expect oneself > Dasein stretches (se tend), bends toward (se tend vers), offers to itself (se tend), offers it to itself (se le tend)
death, impossible simultaneity (where one and the other arrive together), contretemps
for Heidegger, death—stand before (steht bevor) oneself, await, precede oneself as before a mirror, as before the future, “in its ownmost potentiality for being” [see p. 78]

Dasein takes shelter from standing before oneself [in anxiety of death] in gossip (Gerede), far from Unheimlichkeit, structural not accidental modes of Verfallen ——Derrida notes that, for Heidegger, the certainty of death is heterogenous to any other form of certainty, that when one speaks of dying it occurs at limits of truth and untruth

Heidegger’s possibility of an impossibility, is this an aporia? do we situate it in the possibility of an impossibility or the impossibility? not the same thing [Derrida distinguishing his thought of impossible from Heidegger’s?] [cf. HST p. 387 there, Derrida remarks on their affinity]

Heidegger pays no attention to logical form of contradiction (most proper possibility as possibility of an impossibility) > treats it as a condition of truth, its very unveiling (truth no longer measured in logical form of judgment)
als not yet als sich [see ATIA pp. 142-43 for als-structure]
greater and greater orientation toward death, for Heidegger, the incalculable nonmeasure [of truth], signifies possibility of measureless impossibility of existence
seminar is ending, must rush to end, abruptly [death]
principle of ruin nothing other than death, not dying-properly but the end of the properly-dying > threatens and makes possible the [existential] analysis

unique aporia of “expecting death”: 1) impossibility itself, dying as the aporia, impossibility of being dead, of “existing” one’s death 2) or that this impossibility is possible, appears as such, at whose limits one waits, limits of truth, but also possibility of truth
Heidegger: no non-truth for the animal [Aristotle-like]
double sense of de-termination [re: determined closure]: logic of termination (terma, peras, finis) and resolute decision or resolution [Being in Time great discourse on Entschlossenheit]

trace borders to mark and at same time erase these lines, which only succeed in erasing themselves (n’arrivent qu’à s’effacer), trace to introduce their impossibility, principle of ruin, their chance, promises the line while compromising it in parasitage, grafting, divisibility
death signs irreplaceable singularity
for Heidegger, announcement of impossibility of “death,” the awaiting death, can only occur for Dasein

death always the name of a secret, signs irreplaceable singularity, puts forth common name of the proper name w/out name, always a shibboleth > language about death long history of a secret society, hidden religion of the awaiting, a universal Marrano
Marranolike (cryptic awaiting), a universal Marrano
Heidegger: “death”—annihilation of “as such”; can one experience “as such” as such?
“turn what is thus at the very heart of the possibility of the existential analysis against the whole apparatus of Being and Time” > death as most ex-propriating, most inauthenticating
language as origin of “nontruth” of death, does man experience death in purity? Death of other becomes first, again
Heidegger dissociates Verfallen from original sin, but still needs distinction btwn authentic/inauthentic > death as “possibility of impossibility” can mean Eigentlichkeit inhabited by Enteignis

if death is possibility of impossible for Heidegger, Dasein never has relation to death as such, only to perishing, to death of the other (who is not the other), death of other in “me” only death named in syntagm “my death” > thus s’attendre, s’attendre l’un l’autre, s’attendre soi-même à la mort

if death is possibility of impossible for Heidegger, Dasein never has relation to death as such, only to perishing, to death of the other (who is not the other), death of other in “me” only death named in syntagm “my death” > thus s’attendre, s’attendre l’un l’autre, s’attendre soi-même à la mort ——non-access to death where access is only to the threshold, pas, approach to border
that which lives w/ out a name, we’ll give an added name (surnom) [which a name always is]: Marrano (crypto-judaic, crypto-X), believe if you want to the Marranos have come to an end

aporia can never be endured as such, ultimate aporia is impossibility of aporia as such > incalculable reservoir ——death is figure of the aporia such that “death” and death can replace (metonymy that carries name beyond name, beyond name of name) all that is possible as impossible: love, gift, other, testimony

a braid that can’t be cut, 3 twisting movements w/out end: 1) aporia 2) impossible circumscription that foils every methodological strategy, stratagem of delimitation [no knowable edge btwn anthropology & existential analysis] 3) irreducibility of contaminating contraband
Heidegger, Freud, Levinas remarkable witnesses to questioning induced by presuppositions of anthropo-thanatology
fundamentalist dimension not tenable—can’t claim coherence or rigorous specificity
contaminating contraband remains irreducible [insinuates itself in idiom of existential analysis]
[consider existential analysis as a witness] belonging w/out belonging condition of testimony, and of its language first of all
Being and Time repeats all motifs of onto-theology it denies [see pp. 54-5 Judeo-Christian theology]
Marrano: anyone who remains faithful to a secret he hasn’t chosen
Marranos that we are, whether we know it or not, incessantly older & younger, untimely histories, still waiting for the other in a last word infinitely finished
we Marrano’s waiting each other with a secret we haven’t chosen
Kant assigns place of secret in practice of politics to philosophers in his vision of perpetual peace
Kant: “holding power corrupts free judgment of reason”
Derrida notes, w/out developing, Blanchot’s neutral reference to Heidegger, neither approbation nor critique
